newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paris airports for HK and Japan logistics seminars.
newsitem.headline: Paris airports for HK and Japan logistics seminars.

text.p: The Paris airports authority' (ADP) marketing department said it will take part in two one-day seminars in the Far East later this year to promote France's freight expertise.
The seminars have been organised by the the French Ministry of Economy and Finance and the regional development agency, DATAR and will be held in Hong Kong on November 21 and in Tokyo on November 26.
An ADP official says it will be represented by its freight marketing chief, Jean-Alain Ress.
The French delegation in Hong Kong and Tokyo include representatives from France's state railways (SNCF), customs authorities and the country's two largest sea ports, Le Havre and Marseille.

"The seminars will explain what France can offer exporters, airlines and ocean-going operators in Hong Kong and Japan in terms of multi-modal freight transport and distribution solutions," a French ministry official said.
The ministry had organised a logistics seminar in Seoul in April 1996, the official added. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
